children.text: 1. Click on the Fetch User Table button and note that the Users data is displayed in the table. 2. Click on the Fetch Movies button and note that the Movies data is displayed in the table.

1. Connect to the desired data sources and create 2 queries that fetch the data sets and configure them to run on page load. 2. Add a Table widget. 3. Add 2 Button widgets and set Labels for them. 4. Use Navigate To in the onClick event of each button and set the parameters accordingly. 5. Create a function inside a JS Object that returns the data of the desired query conditionally (based on the query parameters). 4. In the Table widget, call the JS function created in step 5 to populate the table.
Note: Please hover over pointers (1, 2) in this app; they point to the parts of the app that you should look at to understand how it is built.
Conditionally Change Table Data Based on queryParams
This app demonstrates how to conditionally show data from different queries depending on the queryParams. We use a JS Object to figure out which data to show.

children.tooltip: Please take a look at the `onClick` binding of the alongside buttons.

Please take a look at -
1. the queries;
2. the `Data` Js Object we've used to figure out which data should be shown.
